item.title: Thinking In Java Ch2 Introduction to Objects
item.description: Thinking In Java Ch2 Introduction to Objects Alan Kay总结了Java的五个基本特点 Everything is an object.Think of an object as a fancy variable; it stores data, but you can “make requests” to that object, asking it to perform operations on itself. In theory, you can take any conceptual component in the problem you’re trying to solve (dogs, buildings, services, etc.) and represent it as an object in your program. A program is a buch of objects telling each other what to do by sending messages.
